results.name: Minimal (positive) solution a(n) of Pell equation b(n)^2 - D(n)*a(n)^2 = +4 with D(n)= A077425(n). The companion sequence is a(n)=A077428(n).
comment: For the conversion of the (x,y) values of Perron's table to the (b(n),a(n)) values see a A077428 comment.
For the general solution of Pell b^2 - D(n)*a^2 = +4 see a comment in A077428 (with a and b interchanged).
reference: O. Perron, "Die Lehre von den Kettenbruechen, Bd.I", Teubner, 1954, 1957 (Sec. 30, Satz 3.35, p. 109 and table p. 108).
link: Steven R. Finch, Class number theory [Cached copy, with permission of the author]
mathematica: d = Select[Range[5, 300, 4], !IntegerQ[Sqrt[#]]&]; a[n_] := Module[{a, b, r}, b /. {r = Reduce[a > 0 && b > 0 && a^2 - d[[n]]*b^2 == 4, {a, b}, Integers]; (r /. C[1] -> 0) || (r /. C[1] -> 1) // ToRules} // Select[#, IntegerQ, 1] &] // First; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 52}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 30 2013 *)
